column4: i just installed ubuntu 9.04 and my wireless card is constantly disconnecting, does anyone know why that would be?
type dmesg in terminal and see what the error is.
i'm not sure what i'm looking for
error messages at the end while you connect
are all of the things i'm reading errors?
no, but you should see some error outputs that are obvious
like wifi, eth0 not restarting
cannot reset mac address
etc
i don't see anything like that...any other ideas?
well it comes down to what chipset you have for the wifi
and look at the ubuntu wiki page for it
how can i find that out?
one sec
thanks a lot
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/WiFiHowTo  and
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/WirelessCardsSupported
numbles bluetooth mice should work, but I would install blueman to get it to work
mumbles*
google for that, blueman bluetooth
it is supported and works "out of the box"
